New Records: Antonín Barák became the first Czech Republic player to be sent off at the European Championship since Radoslav Latal vs the Netherlands at Euro 2000. His dismissal, timed at 19:28, was also the earliest sending off in the tournament’s history.
Key Match Events: Hakan Çalhanoglu gave Turkey the lead early in the second half. Tomás Soucek equalised to set up a nervy finish in Hamburg.
Pre-Game Insights: Mojmír Chytil replaced the injured Patrik Schick up front for the Czechs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw the most cards ever in a European Championship game with 18 cards shown (16 yellows, 2 reds).
Others: Turkey advanced to the knockout stages at Euro 2024 while the Czechs were eliminated. Vincenzo Montella’s side will play Austria in the round of 16 on Tuesday.
